content.description:
Left around the corner from "

Slouch Machine

" is a short, blank looking wall.  (SDS) on bad holds up make a few desperate moves to the final jug finish!!

Difficult for being so short.  Fun!!
content.location: Approach as for the main "Peabody Wall."  Located about 50 feet left of the main wall in a shady area.

content.description:
(SDS) on the low jug system left of "

Nipper

."  Climb up and left through the left-leaning jug system to the top.

Good problem and a nice warm-up.
content.location: Approach as for the main "Peabody Wall."  Located about 50 feet left of the main wall in a shady area.

content.description:
(SDS) on the far left (corner/wall) on the "Little Peabody."  Traverse up and right on small but textured holds while avoiding the upper lip's jugs for full value!!!  Continue climbing until about mid way around the wall.  You should be making your exit right around the same finish as for "

Slouch Machine

."  Fun climbing.  A little contrived but worth a run if you are in the area.
content.location: Approach as for the main "Peabody Wall."  Located about 50 feet left of the main wall in a shady area.

content.description:
(SDS) on the farthest bulging arete located on the right most side of the "Little Peabody" Boulder.

Start on bad feet and thin hands.  Pull like mad to the poor but textured holds above.

The low level jugs left of the (SDS) for "Nipper" are off for this problem!!!
content.location: Approach as for the main "Peabody Wall."  Located about 50 feet left of the main wall in a shady area.

content.description:
(SDS) as for "

Nipper

."  Pull up on the arete crimps on "

Nipper

" and then move quickly out and to your left into better holds.  Don't let the feet dab!!!  Finish up by continuing to climb up the obvious, left-leaning jug system to the top-out.  An overlooked problem for sure!!!
content.location: Approach as for the main "Peabody Wall."  Located about 50 feet left of the main wall in a shady area.
